relatedConcepts: Persephone - Goddess of spring and Queen of Underworld
Demeter - Goddess of harvest and agriculture

philosophicalMeaning.transformationThroughLoss: Persephone becomes Queen of Underworld, transformed by her experience
philosophicalMeaning.seasonalCycle: Death and rebirth of vegetation personified as maiden's descent and return
philosophicalMeaning.bindingFood: Eating food of another realm creates obligation - universal mythic motif

description: The abduction of Persephone by Hades explains the origin of the seasons. Persephone, daughter of Demeter (goddess of harvest), is gathering flowers when the earth opens and Hades, god of the underworld, seizes her to be his queen. Demeter's grief causes all crops to wither. Zeus intervenes, but because Persephone ate pomegranate seeds in the underworld, she must spend part of each year below (winter) and part above (spring/summer).
significance: Female descent to underworld and return
name: Greek Mythology
